summary: SummaryHighlightsCruelty FreeVeganHOURGLASS Veil Translucent Setting Powder is a weightless, 100% vegan loose powder that blurs imperfections for a natural, seamless finish.
details: DetailsBenefitsBlurs the appearance of pores, fine lines and wrinkles for an airbrushed finishInnovative gold sifter and custom cap allow for the perfect amount of product to be dispensed, without creating a messSets makeup for longer wearTranslucent formula leaves an invisible finish, perfect for all skin tonesInfused with diamond powder for the most refined light refraction without any flashbackCan be used to bake undereye concealer to prevent creasingFormulated without talcCruelty freeFormulated WithoutParabensFragranceNanoparticlesItem 2572599How To UseUsing the Veil Powder Brush, pick up a small amount of powder and tap off excess. Apply powder all over the face to set makeup.IngredientsTranslucent: Mica, Alumina, Polymethylsilsesquioxane, Methyl Methacrylate Crosspolymer, Boron Nitride, Hdi/Trimethylol Hexyllactone Crosspolymer, Silica, Diamond Powder, Sorbic Acid, Sodium Dehydroacetate, Bismuth Oxychloride (CI 77163), Iron Oxides (CI 77491, CI 77492).*Ingredient lists and claims may change or vary from time to time as part of our commitment to innovation and maintaining global compliance. Please refer to the ingredient list on the product packaging you receive to ensure the ingredients are suitable for your personal use.Shipping & Coupon RestrictionsThis brand is excluded from most Ulta Beauty coupons.See brand eligibility details
how_to_use: Using the Veil Powder Brush, pick up a small amount of powder and tap off excess. Apply powder all over the face to set makeup.

reviews.headline: Best setting powder
reviews.comments: I have tried a lot of brands from cheap to expensive. This is worth the splurge. It lasts a long time. A little goes a long way. The finish is so smooth and the texture is so soft. It is very forgiving if you used too much.

reviews.headline: The best setting powder out there
reviews.comments: This is truly the best setting powder I've tried. Especially for under the eyes. I've tried them all. Literally. It's so soft and buttery. Doesn't crease and looks so beautiful on the skin. Like there's nothing even there. I pop out the lid for Easier access. It's definitely worth the money

reviews.headline: Great Replacement for Wowder
reviews.comments: I had been using Glossiers lightest shade of Wowder for the longest time but have been unable to get more. This has been a pleasant replacement. Maybe better than my Wowder? I use the translucent shade to lightly set my liquid foundation (either Jones Road WTF or NARS light reflecting) or use on my tzone when just wearing sunscreen. It doesnt take much but I'm only using powder to reduce shine not necessarily to "lock" anything in place. Feels weightless and doesn't break me out. Worth the price.

reviews.headline: Best setting powder, period!
reviews.comments: I have tried dozens of setting powders. I have oily aging skin. This powder is not too drying, nor does it settle in my fine lines.

reviews.headline: LOVE IT
reviews.comments: Ive tried so many different setting powders and this is my ride or die. I have super oily, sensitive, acne prone skin, and this gets rid of my oiliness in an instant! It has a beautiful matte finish, and i would never think about switching to any other setting powder. Its PERFECT for my under eyes, i have a lot of creases, and this blurs them like its nothing!

reviews.headline: Best Setting Powder IMO
reviews.comments: This is the first setting powder ive found that instantly blurs and sets my under eyes. Perfect for all day wear as it doesnt crease AND feels like nothing on the skin. I tell all my friends about this product.

reviews.headline: Best Setting Powder IMO
reviews.comments: This is the first setting powder ive found that instantly blurs and sets my under eyes. Perfect for all day wear as it doesnt crease AND feels like nothing on the skin. I tell all my friends about this product.

reviews.headline: Not great
reviews.comments: Does not wear well... wears off in spots. Bad product, let alone for that price!

reviews.headline: It's a good powder…not for the price
reviews.comments: I overall like this powder its a nice one. You have to apply it very carefully however to avoid looking cakey. The packaging is also super inconvenient. Its nice but not for how expensive it is.

reviews.headline: Creases even when combined with the concealer
reviews.comments: The worst powder I've ever used Creases so bad even when combined with the concealer, I would recommend this powder to my worst enemy..

reviews.headline: definitely
reviews.comments: Make up stays on for for a while

reviews.headline: Beautiful and natural
reviews.comments: This powder is perfect for my 42 year old skin. I do not enjoy the matte look anymore, I have to be very careful in choosing the right products to make my skin glow, this is so good and exactly what i was looking for. It sets my make up but leaves the most perfect sheen and makes my skin look healthy. Paired with the double sided brush is the perfect duo!

reviews.headline: Creases if you have dry skin
reviews.comments: This powder creases and terribly even when paired with the hour glass concealer, the morphe bake & set powder does a better job

reviews.headline: Great to minimize fine lines
reviews.comments: At 55, like another reviewer said, I stopped using powder because it seemed to settle into every line. Not this! I have dry skin and used it on my forehead and under eye areas to set foundation. It reduced visibility of under eye circles and lines, brightening my complexion and no settling into my fine lines! Great product!

reviews.headline: The only powder for mature skin!
reviews.comments: Wow, just wow. At 55 yrs old, I had abandoned powder; and I tried many=matte, chalky, flat, or way too sparkly. This one is so good…superfine milled and just the right amount of gentle luminosity. I can even use it under my eyes and the eyelids to set foundation/concealer/cream color. Pricey, but will last a long time and worth every penny. I only wish it came in a travel size, too. Highly recommend.

reviews.headline: I've loved those products a long time
reviews.comments: Beautiful

reviews.headline: only a few tries in
reviews.comments: but I am loving it so far. it is brightening without a cast, smoothing, and lightweight. Ive been using it only on my under eyes and I love how it leaves them. I set the rest of my makeup with a matte powder. I wanted something brightening and smoothing for my under eyes and I think this will become a holy grail for me.

reviews.headline: Perfect!!!
reviews.comments: This will be my go to setting powder for more years to come. I love that there really is no waste and you just dip your sponge or brush in there. I have an oily t-zone and this always does the trick for me.

reviews.headline: Read me
reviews.comments:
A lot of product gets wasted bcs when the powder gets dumped on top of the rim when opening it tends to spills everywhere and sometimes the last of the powder will not come out no matter how much you shake. After a couple hours the shine comes back so doesn't last to long. I can say I
 prefer Laura Mercier!

reviews.headline: Nice, light setting powder
reviews.comments: A nice light veil to set makeup. Leaves the skin looking nice and finished.

properties.name: Cons

values.label: Less product for the price point

display_values: Less product for the price point

properties.name: Pros

values.label: Has a great glow without being glittery or shiny

display_values: Has a great glow without being glittery or shiny

faceoff_positive.comments: This setting powder sets my makeup and gives my skin a beautiful perfected look. I love how finely milled this product is and it doesn't overly mattify.  It is perfectly balanced!  The design of the packaging is very thought-out and looks luxurious.  Hourglass really knocked the ball out of the park with this setting powder.  The only con I would mention is that for the price, there maybe could be a little more product if you want to compare it to others in the same price range, but you would also need a less of this product to get the job done so that is also something to take into consideration.  A little does go a lot further with this powder compared to others on the market.
faceoff_positive.headline: The Best Setting Powder!

faceoff_negative.comments:
Ok so to start, I am 40. And while I'm pretty fortunate to not be riddled with wrinkles, I have a few fine lines. And noticing no matter what powder I try it settles into the creases so bad. And I have tried some amazing powders. Smashbox halo, Kim chi, Bobbi Brown. All of these are amazing products. But maybe not so much for mature skin. Which I'm not all the way there, but I definitely don't want a product that accentuates my fine lines. ￼I saw a review of this product on Flip. It looked awesome. But again I figured it would just end up like the other ones, but then I was in store I saw it. I tried it on the back of my hand, which has more fine lines than my face will ever have. ￼ And I was so impressed I bought it. Tried it this morning and WOW. It's so fine that it does not accentuate fine lines. This is an amazing product and my very first hourglass product. And a forever staple in my makeup arsenal! OBSESSED!!!! 

I do see reviews saying that they wish there was more product in there, but when I look at all of the other powders that I have it at has the same amount, so people might be referencing the travel size versus the full size.
faceoff_negative.headline: I'm OBSESSED
